newsitem.title: INDIA: India castor prices down on sluggish export demand.
newsitem.headline: India castor prices down on sluggish export demand.

text.p: Indian castorseed September prices on Friday fell by 2/3 rupees at 1,144/1,145 rupees per quintal on renewed speculative offerings, dealers said.
"Sluggish export demand and improved arrivals dragged prices lower," one dealer said.
Arrivals of castorseed in the Gujarat region rose to 12,000/13,000 bags (75 kg each) against a recent daily average of 8,000/10,000 bags.
"Foreign buyers are demanding Indian castoroil at $725 per tonne while Indian offers remain at 740 dollars," one operator said.
"Groundnut oil slid by two rupees at 377/378 rupees per 10 kg on improved arrivals from southern states but inflow from Gujarat region remained low," one miller said.
In Rajkot spot groundnut oil was steady at 595/600 rupees per 15 kg.
In Bombay, imported palm oil rose by a rupee at 256/257 rupees per 10 kg on the back of recovery in the world market.
"Palm oil prices in the local market may react again as we are expecting fresh arrivals at the Mumbai (Bombay) port next week," a dealer said.
